page.title: 04ECOLOGY: The valley
page.content:
The surroundings of the{Wallop Brook} are very beautiful.They have lots of different kinds of{flowers.}Where the fields are not cultivated they are closely grazed by{sheep, cows}and {horses. You see lots of birds flying over head. There are many kinds of birds like the{house martin}and sometimes the{seagull,}also there are fish in the stream like{trout}and{minnows,}and many invertebrates such as{shrimps.}If you look closely you might see an{eel or a{water-vole}coming from under the bridge. Summer is the best time of the year to see the{ducklings}paddling with their mothers.{Mallard, ruddy {shelduck, coot, moorhen, dabchick}and {Canada geese}can be seen.
{
